sub_title: Experienced global health professional with a focus on the private sector and access to medicine in lower income settings.
summary:
A committed policy professional with a passion for the disciplines of bioethics, health innovation, equitable access, trade and development. 

I have a solid public sector background encompassing project, people and policy management skills. I am organised, analytical, and enjoy both supporting, developing and learning from my colleagues.

My career has centered on health policy in an international context. I have pursued and secured experience at the World Health Organization, followed by responsibility for highly sensitive reviews of policy at the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Authority.  My international experience was deepened during a post at UK Intellectual Property Office where I was responsible for representing the UK Government on trade and access to medicine issues. More recently I've worked directly in health research and development issues while based in Geneva at COHRED, prior to joining the Access to Medicine Foundation in Amsterdam in a management role. There I gained a deep understanding of the role (and responsibility) of the private sector in supporting access to medicine in low and middle income countries.  I was most recently in a management role at the Clinton Health Access Initiative, focused on supporting equitable access to HIV prevention interventions.

Specialities: Health policy, public consultation, intellectual property, development, stakeholder relationships, project management, communications, analytical problem solving, private sector engagement.

"One of the criticisms I've faced over the years is that I'm not aggressive enough or assertive enough, or maybe somehow, because I'm empathetic, I'm weak. I totally rebel against that. I refuse to believe that you cannot be both compassionate and strong." 
- Jacinda Ardern

profile_positions.description: European Patent Office cooperation with IP offices, international organisations, key stakeholders and IP user groups
profile_positions.title: Regional Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Providing advice, support and partnership to R.A.T.E across the domains of access to health, sustainability and corporate social responsibility.
profile_positions.title: Advisor, Business partner

profile_positions.description: Leading development and execution of the research underpinning the Index. Responsible for development of methodology, engagement with the global health community, research, team development and management, scoring and company analytics.
profile_positions.title: Research Programme Manager

profile_positions.description: Research and analysis regarding the activities of the top 20 pharmaceutical companies relating to access to medicines in low and middle-income countries.  Particular focus on company activities in public policy, and in patents & licensing.
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher

company.name: Council on Health Research for Development (COHRED)

profile_positions.company: Council on Health Research for Development (COHRED)
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for development and execution of COHRED meetings and networks, both virtual and physical.  These include the Global Forum for Health Research, COHRED Colloquia, amongst other events still in development.

Responsible for co-ordination of the EU Framework 7 funded consortium 'MASCOT' - www.mascotfp7.eu - an international group committed to identifying and addressing maternal and child health inequalities through international co-operation.

Responsible for management of COHRED's 'Fair Research Contracting' initiative - a project aimed at addressing inequalities in research contract negotiation between lower and higher income partners in research.

Responsible for the COHRED co-leadership of health workplan in EU Framework 7 funded consortium. This consortium of organisations - CAAST-NET Plus - was set up to support bi-regional policy dialogue on science and technology between Africa and the European Union.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager

profile_positions.company: Council on Health Research for Development (COHRED)
profile_positions.description: Research, project management, conference programming, stakeholder management
profile_positions.title: Policy Analyst

profile_positions.description: Engaged to analyse data to develop narrative content of a technical area of the 2012 Index.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Lead UK delegate at the WIPO Intergovernmental Committee on Genetic Resources, Traditional Knowledge and Folklore.

Lead on UK policy on IP and genetic resources at the TRIPS council at the World Trade Organisation.

Lead on UK policy relating to IP in the context of international trade and access to medicines.
 
Lead on capacity building project in South Africa - focused on improving the transfer of health technology from universities to industry.

Provided policy advice to UK negotiating team on the CBD Nagoya Protocol on access and benefit sharing.

Provided policy advice to UK negotiating teams at both the World Health Organization’s Pandemic Influenza Preparedness (PIP) Process, and the Intergovernmental Working Group (IGWG) on Substandard, Fake and Falsified medicines.

Line manager.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor - Public Health and Intellectual Property

profile_positions.description:
Project Manager for revision of HFEA Code of Practice, which regulates the fertility sector in the UK. 

(Co-ordinated legal proofing of content, addressing consultation feedback, developed guidance, Committee sign-off, Ministerial sign-off, production and distribution. Communications to stakeholders and internal staff. Led on engagement events involving 50-70 clinic staff, explaining key changes.)

Represented HFEA at external stakeholder events, including Human Genetics Commission, and Progress Educational Trust, Specialised Commissioning Groups.

Project Manager for consultation into the licensing process for the genetic testing of human embryos. 

(Developed revised policies, held consultation event, briefed Chair and CEO, sought legal advice, led internal project team, wrote committee papers, managed internal comms, liaison with press office.  Achieved sign-off from Authority.)

Line management of member of staff.  Performance management.

Primary liaison for Parliamentary Questions.
profile_positions.title: Policy Manager

profile_positions.description:
Project managed high risk, politically sensitive consultation event on human embryo testing. Facilitated participation of disabled stakeholders. Produced discussion document. Briefing of CEO, comms, and speechwriting. 

Key member of HFE Act implementation team. Drafted HFEA response to Department of Health storage regulations. 

Ethics and Law Committee (ELAC) Secretariat.  Presented Committee papers on areas of ethical interest to HFEA. 

Researched and designed Ethics briefings for ELAC. Responsible for servicing ELAC meetings, taking minutes, facilitating debate, arranging external speakers, developing forward work plan.

Answered complex and sensitive queries explaining policy to patients, practitioners and stakeholders.  

Freedom of Information officer for team.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer

profile_positions.description:
Led on EDCTP-funded project for initial period.  Project involved web-based mapping of Research Ethics Committees in sub-Saharan Africa.  Developed communications, presentations.  Involved co-ordination of disparate team members based in Geneva, Manila, Riyadh and Durban.

Writing of final report and communications strategy for the Global Forum on Bioethics in Research Secretariat, in Geneva. 

Developed policy recommendations for the future stability of the Forum.

Oversight of communications function of the Global Forum on Bioethics in Research. Delivered newsletters, updated website, and press releases.
profile_positions.title: Consultant
